page.title: 16LIFE STYLES- Boosbeck surv.
page.content: Boosbeck is a very small place. It is named after a beck called Boo's. The name means 'The stream by the cowshed'. There are few houses. In 1985 32 houses were planned and 72 were demolished. The population has decreased over the years. Between 1981 and 1985 for instance, the numbers dropped by 103 to give a population of 982. This has happened because the mines and railway have closed down. Apart from the local farms the industry with most empoyed people is the abattoir. The meat produced is local. To improve Boosbeck you would need new shops and houses. One of the only new things built is Lockwood Primary School. I think that there should be other new facilities in the town, for children.
